summary:
I combine business focus with feeling and knowledge for technology and innovation. As a true connector and teamplayer, I know how to convey this to those involved from different disciplines. As a people manager I can manage a team to bring out the talent, creates trust to develop initiatives from myself and the team. I always think in terms of solutions and I know how to create opportunities. 
With my expertise in the field of quality and testing, I can make the difference. With this expertise, I can let teams and projects make great progress in modern developments such as Agile and the corresponding degree of automation. With an extensive set of social skills, I have a feeling for organizations and I can easily explain complex matters. I coach and coach teams, I can be a mentor for team members and other stakeholders. I recognize which improvements are possible, which results can be achieved and how the team members can work it out. I am an example for giving and receiving constructive feedback and stimulating the behavior within the teams. 

I am an experienced agile test consultant, including experience as a Scrum Master and Product Owner. With a proven history of working in the information technology and services sector as a Agile Test Consultant, Test Manager and Test Coordinator. Skilled in Agile Scrum, requirements analysis, coaching, ITIL, test management, project management and keen interest in Blockchain. Also trained in Unit Management and Sales.

certifications.name: ISTQB Certified Tester
certifications.authority: ISTQB - International Software Testing Qualifications Board

company.name: ISTQB® - International Software Testing Qualifications Board

certifications.name: ITIL Practitioner in IT Servicemanagement / Incident Management / Service Desk

profile_positions.title: Agile Test Consultant Backoffice at Quion

profile_positions.description:
As an agile test consultant I joined a scrum team. I worked on a system called QSP (Quion Service Platform) for the midoffice, where all mortgages from application to contract are processed. Quion aims to automate as many processes as possible with surrounding systems and third parties. My goal was to test QSP together with external sources, through HDN (Mortgages Data Network). And though ECH (Electronic Communication Mortgages) as a link to integrate the automate communication with Notaries.

Responsibilities
• Refine epics and user stories
• Provide input and participate in sprint planning, sprint review, retrospective and improve collaboration
• Provide input and participate in the refinement sessions
• Work on user stories and tasks in the sprints. The tasks are mainly based on test preparation, drafting test cases,
test execution, automating test cases (Finesse / Toolchain).
• Many of the above points were set up and maintained in Jira.

Epics and user stories that I worked on are related to the integration of ECH (Electronic Communication Mortgages) with QSP to automate communication with Notaries.

The subjects below are tested with QSP together with HDN (Mortgage Data Network)
• MijnOverheid (an external source where you can get information about the applicant)
• Kadaster (an external source where you can get information on property data)
• Calcasa (an external source where you can get information on online property appraisals)
• MPO (MijnPensioenOverzicht: an external source where you can get information about the applicant what is income is when he retires)
• IBL (InkomensbepalingLoondienst: An external source where you an get information on the income of an applicant)
profile_positions.title: Agile Test Consultant Midoffice at Quion

profile_positions.description:
Quion has asked to fulfill the role as Product Owner for the back office processes temporarily, until a new suitable internal collegue was found to fulfill this role.

In addition to the tasks that a Product Owner has, I helped the Agile Coach within Quion to implement improvements within the organization, such as magic estimation of epics, improving the portfolio board, improving how to prioritize an epic or user story.

As a result, I managed the Product Backlog and representing the stakeholders well. Monitoring progress and collaboration with 2 scrum teams and Scrum Master went smoothly, so the next Product Owner was able to take over the PO role after a few months. In addition, the Agile Coach was very happy with my insights into the ideas surrounding Agile and gave my knowledge to other colleagues within Quion.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner (interim) at Quion

profile_positions.description:
Due to illness of a scrum master, I was asked to replace the scrum master for a backoffice scrum team within Quion in his absence. 

I have performed all tasks associated with a scrum master. I also helped the Agile Coach to point out improvements to the Agile process.For example, improving the quality of acceptance criteria within the user stories.

Quion was satisfied how I facilitated the scrum team. where possible, I coached and took away  obstacles where necessary let the scrum team perform as good as possible. The Agile coach was also very happy with my help as a scrum master, including the additions to the epics and user stories to set a higher standard on quality and measurement.
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master (interim) at Quion

profile_positions.location: Capelle aan den IJssel, Provincie Zuid-Holland, Nederland
profile_positions.description:
Quion wanted to bring a risk module into production that would be integrated
with QSP (Quion Service Platform). Quion asked me to help setting up and manage the testprocess.

Responsibilities
• Making a test plan
• Provide insight into the risks
• Managing the test team
• Set up and maintain findings management
• Create a Communication flow as transparant as possible towards stakeholders to be able to make solid choices for the intake to production
• Collaboration with Topicus (supplier of the
Risk module) on the testprocess to run it as smoothly as possible.

As a result, the stakeholders could make an informed choice
to take the risk module into production, based on insight and
results that came from the test execution, the remaining risks and findings.
profile_positions.title: Testmanager at Quion

profile_positions.description: Developing and providing Blockchain workshops for "beginners" and supporting as coach during the Blockchain workshops. The target group are customers of Sogeti who work from a Business background or IT background.
profile_positions.title: Workshop Developer Blockchain for beginners

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for 15 Sogeti QA professionals who are seconded to Logius (customer of Sogeti). I have performed the following tasks:

 - Relationship management with various parties within Logius
 - Thinking about content solutions for the customer to achieve the best result for his projects.
 - Drafting and adjusting offers and invoices
 - Drafting and adjusting contracts
 - Preparation of monthly KPI reports
 - Solving resourcing challenges, such as hiring or replacing staff.
profile_positions.title: Delivery and Servicemanagement at Logius

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for drafting and implementing quality improvement proposals for various international projects based on SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) to save costs and deliver high quality products. I have performed the following tasks:

- Analyze the current state of the current projects.
- Understand needs from a management and operations perspective (managers from different departments, product owners, business analysts, developers and testers).
- Preparation and implementation of quality improvement proposals within international projects based on the SAFe framework (Scaled Agile Framework).
- Setting up a structure of KPI reports for management and operations. This gave management, operations, product owners and scrum masters insight into the performance and they were able to implement improvements themselves based on the KPI reports.
- Improving the User Stories together with Business analysts to make them measurable / testable, to set sharper acceptance criteria and to add test scenarios by means of Test Driven Development (TDD).
In addition, to teach developers and testers to critically assess User Stories before they are accepted in a sprint.
- Introduction of Jira in various international projects. This is to promote cooperation between the project members and management, to be able to follow the project and to make adjustments where necessary to deliver the products on time and with high quality.
- Implementing improvements per project to make the test process per sprint and Product Increment more efficient and measurable.
- hiring and coaching new testers
- Giving workshops to create support for the Agile way of working.

I have performed the above tasks and responsibilities in the Netherlands, but also on location in the United States, England, Germany, Belarus and Hungary.
profile_positions.title: Agile Quality Coach | Testmanager at Wolters Kluwer

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for testing products of KPN for the business market (domain names, hosting and websites, Office, Onedrive, backup) in combination with the Cloud platform from a chain perspective and User perspective, resulting in a correct working delivery of the product to the business customer. I have performed the following tasks for this project:

- The test process has been made transparent and traceable for the project members and the management by organizing JIRA for the project with associated KPIs and reports.
This with the help of managing different test teams.
- Introducing a chain test, in which entry and exit criteria were set up to start the User Acceptance Test. For the supplier, it became clear what entry criteria they had to meet to deliver the (sub) products before we could start the User Acceptance Test.
- By allowing the Business to think about what to test in the previous test levels, findings were found much earlier. This resulted in less pressure on the User Acceptance Test and a shorter turnaround time of the test execution.
- At the same time, KPN was in a transition from the waterfall way of working to the Agile way of working. This meant that I had to prepare the test process differently from the CARE layer at the chain test level. With the transition to the Agile way of working it was be possible to adjust the chain tests per sprint,
- In collaboration with Agile Coaches and scrum teams, improvements were regularly made to the test process.
profile_positions.title: Testmanager Cloud Services bij KPN

profile_positions.description:
My role was E2E test manager for the product KPN Veilig and KPN Up. These products can be ordered via kpn.com. After that, the orders are processed in KPN's delivery street and are offered as an app for the PC, MAC, Android, IPhone and Windows Phone. I was responsible for initiating and maintaining communication between the various suppliers, test parties, domains and test levels for the KPN Safe and KPN Up project. The tasks I had were as follows:

 - Providing a Test Strategy
 - Risk management : Mapping the product risks and devising measures, together with the stakeholders, to limit or eliminate the risks.
 - Making the E2E test planning and the User Acceptance Test planning, planning of deliverable sub-products, arrange resources for test preparation and execution, arrange  available test environments.
  - Findings Coordination of E2E tests and User Acceptance Test
  - helping with specifying the testcases
  - Helping with the testexecution
  - Deliver progress reports to the management of KPN.
profile_positions.title: Testmanager Apps KPN

profile_positions.description:
For a Business Intelligence project within KPN I performed the role of Test Coordinator. The goal was to set up the User Acceptance Test in a structured manner, so that the users, supplier and management can gain insight into what the Quality of the application is, how it is tested and with which results. At the same time I was responsible for the preparation and execution of the User Acceptance Test per release. The tasks were as follows:

 - Create awareness within the project about what the purpose of a User Acceptance Test is and what you can achieve with it.
 - By setting up entry and exit criteria to start the User Acceptance Test, it became clear for the external supplier of the Business Intelligence application that they had to meet these criteria to deliver the product before we could start the User Acceptance Test.
 - Organizing and supervising the User Acceptance Testing
 -  Setting up HP ALM: we knew per release which requirements were in scope, which test cases we wanted to perform and which findings emerged during the test execution. Every day, a test report was generated from HP ALM with 1 push of a button, in which progress was automatically recorded. This information provided clarity towards the business and management. As a result, adjustments could be made where necessary.
profile_positions.title: Test coordinator Business Intelligence at KPN

profile_positions.description:
As a test coordinator, I was responsible for the system tests and integration test for the Billing & Collecting program within Ziggo.

The application landscape for Billing was very outdated. In order to send the invoices to the customer, many manual actions were required at that time. The goal was to have these actions take place automatically. This means less work pressure for the employees and more service can be provided to the customer by replacing the outdated billing application with the new billing application. The functionality of a number of corresponding systems, such as CRM and order management, also needed to be adjusted accordingly. My tasks were as follows:

- Leading a team with an average of 8 testers. These testers have prepared, specified and executed the system tests and integration test with the aim of delivering a correct working chain that met the requirements and designs.
- Coordination with the parties involved (designers, developers and the business), drawing up test plans per system test and integration test and (interim) test reports. This approach created awareness and support for the test approach, resulting in a clear picture of the quality of the systems towards those involved.
profile_positions.title: Test coordinator at Ziggo

profile_positions.description:
As Senior Functional Application Manager, I was responsible, together with fellow Functional Application Managers, for setting up an EPD (Electronic Patient Dossier) within the hospital using the software application Chipsoft. My tasks were as follows:

- I took care of mapping the requirements and wishes of the relevant departments within the hospital, the building, testing, implementation and management of the software application Chipsoft.
- Setting up the test process for the User Acceptance Test with as a result a clear insight into the steps to be taken, deliverables and reports that are necessary for a successful test process and ultimately a well-functioning product.
- Provide training to groups of doctors and nurses who use Chipsoft, resulting in deeper insight and correct use of Chipsoft.
profile_positions.title: Senior Functional Application Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible to facilitate and guide the process around the User Acceptance Test for the Fiber project at KPN. Within this project, a delivery street was developed to deliver the services internet, TV and telephone to the consumer. I had the following tasks:

 - Assess the documentation.
 - Specify the testcases together with the representatives of Customer Care, Finance and Logistics.
 - Helping the representatives Customer Care, Finance and Logistics to accept the product during the User Acceptance Test.
 - Identifying and coordinate the findings and risks that could pose a threat to the products. The findings were logged in Quality Center.
 - Delivery of a weekly test report.
profile_positions.title: Test coordinator at KPN

profile_positions.description:
The goal was to accept a new fine system for the Dutch Railways that would be used by the conductors who are checking the passengers on the train.

My tasks were:
-	Prepare, specify and execute a Functional Acceptance Test for a new fine system.
-	Support the test manager in setting up the test process, by thinking about the most efficient way to go through the documentation, test execution and findings management.
-	Preserve all documents related to the Functional Acceptance Test, so that it could be transferred to the future functional manager of the application.
profile_positions.title: Test analyst at Nederlandse Spoorwegen (Dutch Railways)

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the project was to develop a calculation box to include in a new application to sell insurance policies. As a test analyst, I had the following tasks:
 - Setting up a test process within our team.
 - Writing acceptance criteria to be able to test the intermediate product, test execution was done with MSG PM.Designer and PM.Runner
 - Writing procedures and manuals.
 - Set up and coordinate findings management through Test Director
 - Writing test reports.
 
As a test coordinator, I had the following additional tasks:
 - Managing the workload of the testers, preparing and leading test meetings.
profile_positions.title: Test coordinator | test analyst at Nationale Nederlanden

profile_positions.description:
I was Location Teamleader and test support within PCM Uitgevers and responsible to roll out 2500 new workplaces and support the users with testing and startup issues. The following tasks were assigned to me:
- Managing a team of 4 people to roll out some 2500 new workplaces and provide support to users.
- Making schedules for the team
- Act as a Single point of Contact for different managers and users.
- To explain the new workplace and applications to system coordinators, department heads and key users.

During the testing of the applications within their department, I supported the users in findings management, the re-testing of findings together with the users and the functional management of two test environments.
profile_positions.title: Location Team Leader | Test support at PCM Uitgevers

profile_positions.description:
As a workplace manager I was responsible in a team of 4 people for 1200 workplaces in the Rotterdam region on behalf of PCM Uitgevers. The goal was to have the workstations function as optimally as possible and keep the users satisfied during their busy work schedule. The tasks consisted of:

-	Replacing hardware or installing new hardware installing and configuring operating systems (Windows NT 4.0, 2000 and XP), installing and configuring different software packages.
-	To solve incidents of the above operating systems and software packages (both 2nd and 3rd line).
profile_positions.title: Workplace manager at PCM Uitgevers
